messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: New Board Games
messages.msgSnippet: Oh yes! ... It it such a great game to play with mixed ages. It can be a pretty mean game when played with just adults, too  Cally
messages.messageBody:
Oh yes!

Joni Zander wrote:

>For younger kids playing with older people, we all like the aMazing

It it such a great game to play with mixed ages.

Cally

messages.subject: Re: New Board Games
messages.msgSnippet: For younger kids playing with older people, we all like the aMazing Labrinth.  (Okay, I spelled that wrong, hmmm) Chess for Three (a very interesting twist on
messages.messageBody:
For younger kids playing with older people, we all like the aMazing
Labrinth. (Okay, I spelled that wrong, hmmm)

Chess for Three (a very interesting twist on playing chess)


Not exactly board games, we really like:

Carcasonne (with expansions)

Mad Dash (boy, if you don't know about this one - it is SO much fun -
you connect the states in 2 minutes, the one who gets the most points
wins - coast to coast gets a bonus. Would be a schoolish item, but it
is too much fun!)

Fluxx

Quarto (a very fun four in a row game where your opponent selects the
piece you will place, making it very interesting)
